Content: Has the channels cc made chips obsolete?

Author: rainbro7#4735
Content: With crypto conditions and the Gemini dollar peg coin, can barterdex become a decentralized bitmex? That would be crazy!

Author: rainbro7#4735
Content: Oh okay

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Chips does use CC already its in the CHIPS code.

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: Channels have nothing to do with replacing CHIPS but I think they could be used in place of LN for the same purpose, that is creating temporary gaming tables for CHIPS

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: channels isnt LN, it is dPoW secured mempool transactions. So it is backward compatible with existing infrastructure, but it is all onchain tx, not offchain. So it is different solution and wont help with scaling

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it does however allow instantly validated payments, good for paying at Starbucks and not having to wait for confirms

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so it is more for point of sale applications, not a CHIPS replacement

Content: So if interested might be good to contact them, cheers

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: we aren't holding a dico. it's a normal ICO with kyc. One of our partners is interested in barterdex tech and we are discussing ways of adding a KYC layer to BarterDEX. We still need a proof of concept.

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: the concept is simple though. You whitelist an address and make sure that your BOB doesn't trade with any addresses that aren't whitelisted.

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: the whitelisting process would involve various apis depending on your KYC provider.

Author: jl777c#5810

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: I have a question about the burn protocol for cross-chain tx, I read that Notary Nodes are the ones checking and providing the proofs for this to work. The inner details are of beyond my understanding but do you see it possible in future to use CryptoConditions to blockchain-enforce such cross-chain tx? Without NN having to play a part

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: NN post the merkle roots to the chains during the notarization process. they are not involved in creating the proofs

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: NN notarized

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: using that notarization, the node doing the cross chain can create the proofs

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I dont see how we can keep notarizing without NN

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so I think your assumption is incorrect

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: however, gateways CC uses the oracles CC to get merkle roots onchain and that doesnt involve notary nodes, just the multisig signer nodes

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: I understand, thanks!
